data.title: Good Mexican food, good atmosphere, at a good price.
data.text:
We celebrated my daughter's rehearsal dinner on the side patio of Los Tres Hombres with about 40 guests. The space is beautiful - with space heaters, twinkle lights, & music setting the atmosphere. The buffet dinner was really good, & the selection of foods was top notch. There was adequate space for dancing (really!) To top it off, the margaritas were on point.

If you are looking for an place to host an event (Spring, Summer, Autumn) that will provide really good food on a budget, this could be the place. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Give it a miss, unless you're only there to drink
data.text:
It's rare that I've had poorer service in a restaurant.  I was ignored both upon arrival, and when trying to pay the bill.  Although the server was pleasant, neither he nor his co-worker had any sense of what restaurant service should be.
The food was boring in the maximum, smothered in cheese to disguise it's lack of flavor.
However, they have $2.00 beer night on Wednesdays, which is a bargain, and it's not just the bottled junk.

data.title: Taco Tuesday
data.text: Good Mexican food.  Taco Tuesday's you get all the tacos you can eat for $10.  Your choice of Beef, chicken or pork.  Any and all a good choice.

data.title: Food is pretty good, service not so much!
data.text: We came into an almost empty restaurant, waiting to be seated and nobody came to us or even approached us (not even the lady at the bar, all she did was stare at us). We almost wanted to leave (another party behind us was not happy, either) Finally after about over 10 minutes waiting time somebody seated us (not overly friendly, acceptable would be the proper term). The girl who served us was friendly .... food was surprisingly good, drinks as well. Bummer that the service is only 2 out of 5 stars...they could make more business with better service!

data.title: yummy, yummy, yummy!!!!
data.text: We have been searching forever to duplicate a favorite restaurant of ours that went out of business and specifically we've been looking for the ultimate Chile Verde Burrito and we FOUND it.  At the Cantina it's known as the "Macho" and we decided we'd split the meal because we didn't know what size it would be.  Well it was HUGE!!!  There is a surcharge to split a plate but that was OK .  There were chunks of the chile verde pork on the inside and outside of the burrito and it had the right amount of spice, cheese and beans.  The meat was very tender, you could cut the burrito with a fork and it really was a just sit there and savor the flavors.  It came with a few shreds of lettuce and a healthy dollop of sour cream and by the time we finished we were just plain stuffed.  I plan on placing this place on my list as a "return to" place.  Without splitting the place the meal was about $14 and $1.50 to split a meal.

data.title: good eats...
data.text: Great place to go for dinner and happy hour drinks... within a 5 minute walk from the Nugget in Sparks in the Victorian Square.... nice alternative from eating at the hotel...  Fast and friendly servers...good food and drinks... Reasonably priced!!  Great chips and salsa too.

data.title: Los Tres El Good-O
data.text: Nice place with great service. We were thee for Mothers Day with a large crowd. The Margarita's and chips were the best. All of the appetizers were fresh and tasty. Also there were free Mamosa's for all of the Mom's.

data.title: Taco Tuesdays
data.text: This a a great place to eat. Their combinations are good & you can't beat it for the price. We love their Taco Tuesdays & their Margaritas.

data.title: dinner
data.text: We have eaten here three or four times. The service is average but the food is good. The last time it was raining and the roof was leaking a lot.

data.title: Some different food items
data.text: Unusual design - might have been a factory or printing press prior, high ceiling, clean, lots of seating but very few diners.  Mexican restaurant with standard items (burritos, tacos, rice, beans) and some not so usual items.  Decided to be adventurous and try the chingalingas - quite good!  Service was good - chips, salsa and water initially, and waiter came around to check that everything was okay.  Refilled chips, salsa and water when needed

data.title: A Cavernous Restaurant with Good Food
data.text: This place is like a small warehouse...it's one very large room with a high ceiling.   It's divided into two sections. One side is the bar area with tables.  This is where most of the action is...laughter and drinking.  The other half is populated with tables and booths.  We just had drinks and nachos.  The margaritas were on the sweet side (which I liked)...they used a sweet/sour mix which was quite different than most places use.  The nachos were delicious, especially the shredded beef that came with it.

data.title: The food is fine, it's the service that sucks!
data.text: We stop in here any time we are in the Reno area, which is quite often.  In years past, there were really great waiters and bartenders.  Those seem to have moved on to other jobs. Not really expecting to eat, however needing something to take the dust out of our throats, we immediately headed here.  We walked in expecting the same great service and food and were quick to find out that respect for the customer has disappeared.  The waitress (Amanda) who came to our table was surly from the beginning and after taking our order never once came back to the table.  We all ordered drinks and then quesadillas and I asked if she could have them add jalapenos to them.  She snapped, "we don't have jalapenos!", grabbed my menu out of my hand and walked away.  The others looked at me and then her and asked if I wanted to just walk out.  I never do that, and said "No, maybe she misunderstood".  The quesadillas were delivered by Jim (cook) and he asked where our chips and salsa were?  I told him we had never received them and also understood there were no jalapenos.  He answered that of course, there were jalapenos and he would be back with chips, salsa, and jalapenos in a second.  He came back in very short order, stopping by to show her that they did indeed have jalapenos.  She glanced in our direction, mouthed something of which I could not hear and gave us an angry glare.  I don't know what her problem was, but I will never go to this restaurant again.  And for those of you who have read my reviews, you know that I usually return, even if the service is mediocre.  I am giving two stars only because of Jim and his good food.

data.title: Great variety of Great Mexican Food
data.text: Finally a Mexican restaurant with something for everyone.  Very extensive menu encompassing everyone's tastes.  Great mesquite BBQ, delicious seafood, good traditional food, even chiliquilles and huevos ranchero.  Yummy margaritas. Reasonable prices and excellent service. Try it. Easy parking. Walk from the Nugget.

data.title: Summer Thursday at Sparks, NV--A Good Deal
data.text: My wife and I were riding through Sparks, NV, heading back to Reno and saw a crowd of people and heard music at a shopping center.  We stopped by and enjoyed our evening at a 39 North Marketplace / 39 Downtown event.  We had a blast. Restaurants were open and very busy, bands were playing in several locations and there was a combination of farmer's market and retail booths.  We ate at Cantina Los Tres Hombres.  The food and service were excellent and we recommend the restaurant highly. Prices were reasonable.  One of the bands played in the restaurant's courtyard.  After dinner, we sat and listened to the band there and moved around to listen to the other bands.  If you happen to be in the area for a 39 Downtown event, even better!  You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Old Style Bar with great Mexican food.
data.text:
The patio outside is nice when its not too hot. They have good specials every weekday. The atmosphere kind of reminds me of old Mexico, big wooden booths and brass rails everywhere. 
The food was really great when we last went. Good shrimp appetizer and the fajitas were great!

data.title: Sucks
data.text: Tried to up sell me and charge me after I specified Tuesday Taco all you can eat. Pure Rip Off. Called me a liar. Don't trust these crooks especially Adam the bartender.

data.title: one of our usual places to eat
data.text: Good food, some great employees, full bar, outside seating when the weather is good, live entertainment on certain occasions. Taco Tuesday is one of our favorites. Ask to sit in Leo's section.

data.title: Great carnitas
data.text: Family of 9 and they seated us right away.   They took care of all tastes, from the 3 year old to the 80 year old birthday boy.   Excellent service,       Our waiter recommended the carnitas.  They were among the best I've had, including in Mexico.   Leave the nugget and get great food across the street.

data.title: Give Mexican Food a Try in Sparks, NV
data.text: The food is good, the atmosphere is Casino like and the service friendly.  They have a pretty extensive menu to choose from and a good selection of beer and drinks.  The salsa is very good and I typically rate a Mexican food restaurant by the salsa as I have found if the salsa is good then the food is good and the opposite works the same as well, bad salsa = bad food in my experiences.

data.title: Very disappointing
data.text: The restaurant used to be great.  I don't know if they are cutting back cost or what.  My entree used to be filled with tons if shrimp and crab. It's still says that on the menu, but no shrimp and imitation crab were the contents.  And it was horrible.  In my friends entree the imitation crab also showed up.  If you are going to use that, put it on your menu, not crab.  I complained and the owner/manager came out and have me a $10 gift card to come back again.  We used the card to pay towards our dinner.
